compliance_assessment.framework_description: General Data Protection Regulation - A regulation in EU law on data protection and privacy.

requirements.requirement: Ensure data subject rights are respected, including access, rectification, and erasure.
requirements.evidence: Some mechanisms for data access exist, but not all rights are fully implemented.
gaps: Lack of clear processes for data erasure requests.
No documented procedures for data rectification.
recommendations: Develop and document processes for handling data subject requests.
Implement a user-friendly interface for data access and erasure.

requirements.requirement: Implement data protection by design and by default.
requirements.evidence: Current design does not incorporate data protection principles.
recommendations: Conduct privacy impact assessments for new features.
Adopt data minimization practices in data collection.

requirements.requirement: Ensure data is encrypted in transit and at rest.
requirements.evidence: Some data is encrypted, but not all sensitive data is covered.
gaps: Inconsistent encryption practices across the application.
No encryption for certain sensitive data types.
recommendations: Standardize encryption practices across all data types.
Implement encryption for all sensitive data at rest.

critical_gaps: Lack of comprehensive data subject rights processes.
Insufficient encryption practices for sensitive data.
remediation_plan: Establish a dedicated team to oversee GDPR compliance.
Create and implement a comprehensive data protection policy.
Conduct regular training for staff on GDPR requirements.
